intro: Pycreus fibrillosus, commonly known as the silky pycreus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly appreciated for its ecological role in native habitats.
